item.description:
This is a new hike addition for the group. A looping hike of lower to moderate difficulty. We will hike about 6 miles over a roughly 4 hour period on portions of the Mettabesett trail and the Bear Hill Loop Trail. There will be some cliffs we will walk along, streams and other bodies of water to see, some short steep ups and downs. Overall an interesting trail.

Those who wish to go should have:

* A daypack - To carry trail food, water, and any extra items.
* Hiking boots advised
* 1 quart water
* Bug spray (advised as swampy in some sections)

The meetup will be at 9 AM on/off the shoulder of Aircraft Rd. Parking may be limited so carpooling is encouraged. We would finish up at about 1 PM and some lunch out if the group feels like socializing more.

 

General directions:
* From Rte. 9, take Aircraft Rd. from exit 10
* Go straight at traffic light onto Aircraft Rd.
* Go 0.8 mile and look for oval Mettabesett Trail sign on left (North) side.
* Park on shoulder (try to pull at least half up onto grass to be out of the road)

Aproximate location/directions to trailhead shoulder parking (roughly 400 Aircraft Rd., Middletown, CT): http://classic.mapquest.com/maps?city=Middletown&state=CT&address=400+Aircraft+Rd&zipcode=06457-5725&country=US&latitude=41.514286&longitude=-72.577442&geocode=ADDRESS

Map is in "Connecticut Walk Book: East" 19th ed., by Connecticut Forest and Park Association as map MB-2 on page 20 or in "Connecticut Walk Book: West" 19th ed. as map MB-2 on page 104.

 

=== Legal Stuff ===

I attest and verify that I am physically fit to participate in any portion of this above listed event. I grant Hartford Area Hiking permission to use any photographs, film or videotapes of this event for any purpose.
